claims.claim: The system has implemented robust mechanisms to detect and prevent the execution of malicious code.

subclaims.subclaim: Automated malware detection tools are regularly used to detect and prevent malicious code.

evidence.Description: Regular reports generated by the system’s automated malware detection tools, showing the detection and prevention of malicious code.
Logs from the IDS that demonstrate the system’s ability to detect and block malicious activities.
Documentation of security incidents where the system successfully detected and prevented the execution of malicious code.

claims.claim: All system components are regularly scanned for vulnerabilities that could be exploited by malicious code.

subclaims.subclaim: Regular vulnerability scans are conducted using tools like Nessus or Qualys.

evidence.Description: Regular vulnerability scan reports from tools like Nessus or Qualys, showing the results of scans and the remediation of identified vulnerabilities.

subclaims.subclaim: Regular updates and patches are applied to system components to address known vulnerabilities.

evidence.Description: Records of regular updates and patches applied to system components to address known vulnerabilities.

subclaims.subclaim: Automated scanning tools are configured and used comprehensively.

evidence.Description: Configuration files and settings of automated scanning tools, demonstrating their regular and comprehensive use.
